conclusion: Identify the forces acting on each object
Weight of object A is 50 N
Weight of object B is 100 N
Apply Newton's second law for object A
Tension in rope OA equals weight of object A, 50 N
Apply Newton's second law for object B
Horizontal component of tension in rope OB equals horizontal component of tension in rope OA
Vertical component of tension in rope OB must balance weight of object B
Resolve the tension in rope OB into components
Tension in rope OB horizontal component is T_OB * cos 45 degrees
Tension in rope OB vertical component is T_OB * sin 45 degrees
Equation for horizontal component: T_OB * cos 45 degrees = T_OA
Equation for vertical component: T_OB * sin 45 degrees = W_B
Calculate the tension T_OB
T_OB * sqrt(2)/2 = 50 N
T_OB * sqrt(2)/2 = 100 N
Solve for T_OB: T_OB = 50 * sqrt(2) N
Calculate the tension T_OP
Tension in OP is the same as T_OB, 50 sqrt(2) N
Final answers: T_OA = 50 N, T_OB = 50 sqrt(2) N, T_OP = 50 sqrt(2) N
